content: this text is a legal document outlining the progress of a divorce case between mr v and ms m they have agreed to proceed with a divorce by mutual consent and have two children together the document covers the division of assets and debts as well as the allocation of financial accounts life insurance and real estate the parties have agreed on the use and enjoyment of the property payment of debts and taxes and renouncement of marital benefits gifts and inheritance rights the costs of the proceedings and the deed are to be shared equally they have also agreed on child arrangements including parental authority residence maintenance and the division of costs the document acknowledges the possibility of future changes to the child arrangements the text also explains the progress of a legal case starting with the preparation of a document called elaborat and serving it to the opposing party the court will schedule a hearing where both parties will present their arguments and evidence and the court will make a decision based on the information presented the outcome of the case is not mentioned another part of the text is an agreement between two parties regarding property arrangements after their divorce is finalized the agreement follows the procedures outlined in the judicial code and will take effect on the day the divorce decree becomes final the agreement will be transcribed in the registers of the competent registrar the parties agree that family law agreements will continue to bind them provisionally in the event of a withdrawal of proceedings or waiver of proceedings the text also discusses a legal case involving a real estate company and another party the notary informs the parties about the existence of five inventories related to immovable heritage and their obligation to provide information regarding these inventories the property is considered a forest and the parties are aware of their obligations under the forest decree the property is also located in a flood risk zone and the parties acknowledge their obligations in relation to this lastly the text is a legal document for a residence deed the parties agree to register the deed with the general administration patrimonial documentation and include a mediation clause for dispute resolution the notary must identify any conflicts of interest and the parties confirm their understanding and agreement to the contents of the deed a draft of the deed will be delivered in the future and a digital copy will be available to the parties within fifteen working days of signing
